intro: Apodanthes surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
